properties.areaDesc: Venango, PA; Butler, PA; Mercer, PA; Lawrence, PA
properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 8 at 8:29AM EST until January 8 at 9:30AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh PA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a

* Snow Squall Warning for...
Southern Mercer County in northwestern Pennsylvania...
Southwestern Venango County in northwestern Pennsylvania...
Lawrence County in western Pennsylvania...
Northern Butler County in west central Pennsylvania...

* Until 930 AM EST.

* At 829 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line
extending from 7 miles northeast of New Wilmington to near
Lordstown, moving southeast at 20 mph.

HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow.
Wind gusts up to 30 mph.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

* This includes the following highways...
Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 98 and 125.
Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 40.
Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 4 and 14.

Locations impacted include...
New Castle, Hermitage, Sharon, Grove City, Sharpsville, Farrell,
Slippery Rock, New Wilmington, Oakwood, New Castle Northwest, Mercer
and Pulaski.
properties.instruction:
Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes
your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra
time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead
to accidents.

Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the
visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.

CMAMtext: Snow Squall Warning til 9:30 AM EST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
